javadoc.text: * Represents a sequence as points that's internally stored as a single array of * point components.
* The coordinates of the points, specifically 2x the number of points.
* the number of valid x, y pairs.
* Constructs an XYArray wrapping the given points.
javadoc.param: points array of coordinates defining the points

javadoc.text: * Constructs an XYArray of the given size.
javadoc.param: n number of points XYArray should contain

javadoc.text: * Constructs an empty XYArray.
* Returns the number of points this XYArray represents.
* Converts negative indexes to positive ones by adding numPoints to it.
javadoc.param: i index to be normalized

javadoc.text: * Returns the x component of the point at the given index.
javadoc.param: i index of point
javadoc.return: x component of point at given index

javadoc.text: * Returns the y component of the point at the given index.
javadoc.param: i index of point
javadoc.return: y component of point at given index

javadoc.text: * Returns modified point representing the wrapped point at the given index.
javadoc.param: i index of desired point
dst point to be modified

javadoc.text: * Sets the x component of the point at the given index.
javadoc.param: i index of point to modify
x new x component

javadoc.text: * Sets the y component of the point at the given index.
javadoc.param: i index of point to modify
y new y component

javadoc.text: * Sets the coordinates of the point at the given index.
javadoc.param: i index of point to modify
x new x component
y new y component

javadoc.text: * Sets the coordinates of the point at the given index.
javadoc.param: i index of point to modify
pt point from which coordinate is to be extracted

javadoc.text: * Applies the given transform to all points represented by this XYArray.
javadoc.param: t transform to apply

javadoc.text: * Modifies dst to be the bounding box of the points represented by this * XYArray.
javadoc.param: dst rectangle to be modified

javadoc.text: * Constructs an array of point coordinates for n points and copies the old * values if provided.
javadoc.param: points array to populate with point values, or null to generate a * new array
n number of points
old old values to repopulate the array with, or null if not * desired

javadoc.text: * Constructs an array of point coordinates for n points.
javadoc.param: srcPoints array to populate with point values, or null to generate * a new array
n number of points

javadoc.text: * Adds a subsequence of the points provided at the given position.
javadoc.param: index position at which the points should be inserted
newPoints points from which to extract the subsequence of points
start the start index within newPoints to start extracting points
end the end index within newPoints to finish extracting points

javadoc.text: * Inserts all the provided points at the given position.
javadoc.param: pos index at which to insert the points
pts points to be inserted

javadoc.text: * Adds the provided points to the end of the points.
javadoc.param: pts points to be added

javadoc.text: * Creates an XYArray representing the given points.
javadoc.param: pts points to copy

javadoc.text: * Adds a point to the index provided.
javadoc.param: pos index at which to add the point
x x coordinate of new point
y y coordinate of new point

javadoc.text: * Inserts the given point at the given index.
javadoc.param: pos index at which to add the point
pt point to be inserted

javadoc.text: * Remove a subsequence of points from this XYArray starting as pos.
javadoc.param: pos the position to start removing points
num the number of points to remove

javadoc.text: * Remove all points from this XYArray.
* Returns a clone of this XYArray ensuring a deep copy of coordinates is * made.
